title: An easy way to deal with trolls/inters
body:
Trolls and intentional feeders or players that play so bad they might as well count as one, if they at the end of the game were to get at least 5 reports for intentional feeding they should not be able to queue ranked for at least 5 normal games. 
It's unfair that trolls/inters/players this unskilled should be able to play and plague another match, dragging down other players.
Yes I know people have bad games but this will help with that, take some time from ranked, try a few blind/draft pick and try to improve or polish up your skills.

replies.body: Why are you putting unskilled players in same category as trolls and intentional feeders?

Simple they all have the same thing in common, horrible kda, when i say horrible I'm talking 2/13/2 kind of kda, now there are people who have bad kda but still help the team thus they would not warrant this ranked ban as it need to be from all 4 teammates + 1  from the enemy team, this is just giving them to cool off and play some normal games and polish up their skills, to see if they are in the right mind set for ranked on that day.

it comes down to this: 

how do you tell the difference between having a bad game / couple of games and griefing? 

if you can not, why do you believe sending a person who is doing badly to "the other queue" is justified? As opposed to making the bad player play with the other potatoes through the mechanism of losing MMR?

You all don't get what I am saying, there are games where people perform badly but doesnt warrant a report, it's only the extreme cases do people spam all chat asking for them to be reported, these players need some time away from ranked, take it to practice some more, also this prevents trolls and inters from just joining another match.

I do not understand why a bad player or a player having several poor games should be punished by being forced to take a time out from ranked. 

I do not understand what the justification is. I do not understand that there is a justification. I do not accept that one player failing is an offense against "the other player's game". The "this loser _made me_ lose MMR" is not an argument that I accept. 

I have seen more than my share of players intentionally feeding or griefing in other ways s.a. rage-quitting and taking mini breaks in the game or following the jungler around taking his CS etc. _usually _the people who spam all chat asking for a report are simply dissatisfied at having a failing team member and are 100% incorrect in their report request.

"I do not understand why a bad player or a player having several poor games should be punished by being forced to take a time out from ranked."
if you cannot wrap your brain around the reasoning why, I'm sorry that's on you.
If  person is consistently playing poorly they are not ready for ranked/competitive play, when you go into ranked there are people who take it seriously, these are people devoting their time and efforts into this, troll/inters/RQers/feeders clearly do not take it seriously or lack the skill to be in there, so why punish 4 other players? if you want to play for fun play norms, play bots, play aram, not ranked.
Trolls, feeders, inters or w/e removing them from ranked would improve gameplay for those that take it seriously, it will stop players that troll 20+ games in ranked at plat elo, I am seeing people's arguments but none of them hold water, especially yours.

> if you cannot wrap your brain around the reasoning why, I'm sorry that's on you.

You are talking as if what you are arguing is self evident. to me, It is not. It can be that i'm stupid. It can also be that you only think you have a case here. humor me?

> If person is consistently playing poorly they are not ready for ranked/competitive play

The point of ranked is to differentiate the good players from the bad ones and to make a playing environment where the good play VS the good and the bad VS the bad. 

If a player does not play well, consistently, it does not mean he is not ready, it means he is not good. If he is not good, he should be made to play with the bad players.

The bad players are not the guys in normals; they are the guys in ranked bronze. 

> troll/inters/RQers/feeders clearly do not take it seriously

which is exactly why I switched to ranked: not because I have skill (last month i was b5), but because in ranked, the mid lane assassin that is ahead is actually getting objectives instead of running away from objectives trying to prolong the game and stat pad. 

> or lack the skill to be in there

how much skill do you need to be in ranked? lets quantify it: bronze level of skill? silver level of skill? gold level of skill? If you put me in a gold game I will consistently and reliably feed my ass off. Similarly, once I got more skilled, I outright toyed with them B5s; none of them could play well with me in the game.

You mistake what ranked is. Ranked is not a mode for the people who have the skillz. It is a mode for the people who want to play with others of their own skill level, and to merit playing with better people through improving themselves. 

And also you mistake how skill works. It's not an absolute measure, it is relative. A player like me can play quite competitively, against people of my own skill: But in your skill level I will just feed. 

> so why punish 4 other players 

There you go again, treating the other guy's failure as an act of aggression against yourself. Stop playing the victim.

>   I am seeing people's arguments but none of them hold water, especially yours.

I don't see that I've made an argument yet. Just trying to understand your point of view, and see if you have a case and what that case is, if you have one. 

Here is my point of view:

people who are casual and do not take the game seriously are one type of player.
people who intentionally feed and grief are a second type of player
and people who suck but want a serious game are a third type of player. 

the three types of players deserve different treatments:

The "casuals" deserve a laid back playing field where nobody really cares much about winning and losing. So we'll make a game mode like that and we'll call it "normals"

The people who suck deserve a good game against people of their level, with the people who do not suck spared from playing with them. We'll make a second game mode for them and call it "bronze", and put the good players in "silver", "gold", etc. That way they silvers and gold don't have to deal with their braindead zombie play style, and they don't have to deal with the casuals not playing to win. 

the people who grief we remove from the game or "reform" them because nobody wants to play with them. We'll do that with "reports". 

Your solution is basically to take "bronze" and mix it up with "normals"; And I do not see the advantage or justification in doing that.

You are just taking from the bronze players the advantages of ranked games and throwing them into a game mode where the other players don't care and the matchmaking is so lenient the games are often a contest of who's team has the most high MMR person, and you are putting into the casual games pool a bunch of players who want to tryhard.

People who go out and troll on purpose in ranked do not take it seriously.
There are players in bronze that don't  totally suck
I'm not mixing bronze with norms, that is already done
You all not understanding still what I am proposing here, this isn't ban bronze players from ranked, there are people who do bad and lose but did nothing to warrant a report, which is why it needs 4 players + 1 from the enemy team.
If you constantly go 0/12 game after game after game in ranked, why play it? practice in norms, it not harm to take some time from ranked and play in norms for a bit, then go back into ranked, this is to help them improve, this is to keep them from tilting themselves, this is to keep players from all elo from trolls and those on tilt who keep spamming ranked when they need some time to cool off and reevaluate and reflect on what they are doing wrong in games

Golly, I can't even begin to imagine how this might be abused.
You need 5 reports so you also need 1 from the enemy team, tell me how it will be abused.

It actively encourages public witch hunts to convince people via /all chat to report your own teammates. It demonizes players for having bad games, and incentivizes running up the score against players who fall behind. It also allows enemy teams to gang-report individual opponents for immediate, forced punishments.

No it doesnt, you need at least 5 votes, this isnt a witch hunt, you need all 4 teammates + 1 from the enemy team, this cannot be abused.
*hey this guy is obviously trolling can you all report him at the end?* when you get reported time after time and nothing happens, shall I link to the post about the guy who trolled over 20+ games in Plat and nothing happened to him? 
This is WAY better than the nothing we have atm, you are not punishing them, you are just not allowing them to ruin the game for people that take it seriously, this gives people the chance to practice more in norms than keep spamming ranked when they on *tilt*

Also: -->It actively encourages public witch hunts to convince people via /all chat to report your own teammates. It demonizes players for having bad games, and incentivizes running up the score against players who fall behind<---
This already happens, it happens A LOT, what I propose wont stop or start what is already going on, so lets hear a REAL way this can be abused.

Will players sidetrack the game in order for teams to have discussions about who to report, in order to reach a gang report quota?

Can a team of four trolls convince one opponent to report an innocent fifth? Bam, abuse.

Can a team of five jerks gang-report an opponent to instantly reach that quota? Bam, abuse.

Can a jungler run up the score against losing lanes to incite a punishment against that player? Bam, abuse. 

Can a Bronze player be paired against Golds, stomped, and wind up punished? Bam, unintentional abuse. 

Will players losing lanes stop taking any aggressive action out of fear of getting gang-reported? Bam, hostile environment. 

Will internet connectivity issues result in gang reports, exacerbating standard Leaverbuster penalties by piling on a banishment from ranked?

Are we limited to only one enemy report and require four teammate reports? Better hope you don't have two trolls on your team. Or one person that muted you. Or one person that doesn't agree.

That's off the top of my head. Infinitely more flaws possible. Gang justice is not feasible, practical, or just.
